dcterms:creator: M. Glockner
V. Shwartz
Y. Goldberg
dcterms:description: This dataset is created by modifying SNLI examples with single word replacements of different lexical relations, based on WordNet. It tests lexical inferences and relatively simple world knowledge.
dcterms:title: Glockner et al. (for lexical inferences)

dcterms:creator: A. Naik
A. Ravichander
N. Sadeh
C. Rose
G. Neubig
dcterms:description: This dataset is composed of a variety of tests motivated by a manual examination and categorization of 100 mistakes made by the best performing model at the time. The categories include antonyms, word overlap, negation words, length mismatch, and spelling errors.
dcterms:title: Naik et al.

dcterms:creator: T. McCoy
E. Pavlick
T. Linzen
dcterms:description: This dataset consists of examples generated from manually created templates that break syntactic heuristics. It includes three categories of heuristics: lexical overlap, subsequence, and constituent.
dcterms:title: McCoy et al.

dcterms:creator: A. Wang
A. Singh
J. Michael
F. Hill
O. Levy
S. R. Bowman
dcterms:description: MNLI is a multi-task benchmark dataset for natural language understanding, designed to evaluate models on a variety of language tasks.
dcterms:title: MNLI

dcterms:creator: M. Glockner
V. Shwartz
Y. Goldberg
dcterms:description: This dataset is created by modifying SNLI examples with single word replacements of different lexical relations, based on WordNet. It tests lexical inferences and relatively simple world knowledge.
dcterms:title: Glockner et al. (for lexical inferences)
